body: The only reason to specify the `--ip` arg on the engine is if the information in the connection file is _wrong_, and it should always be a real IP address.

OK, even with that fixed, it still output

```
Registering with controller at tcp://127.0.0.1:59179 <tcp://127.0.0.1:59179>
```

although the correct controller ip address is in the ipcontroller-engine.json file.
Are the controller and engine on the same machine? If so, 127.0.0.1 _is_ the correct IP to connect to.
Only partially. The ones that run on the same machine work fine, the ones on remote machines canâ€™t connect.

@dseuss can you share the ipcontroller-engine.json file? The engine is determining that the controller is running on the same machine as the engine, apparently incorrectly. Typically this means they have an IP address in common.

Does it work if you pass `--ip=public_ip` instead of `--ip=*`?
@dseuss and the log output of the remote engines verifies that they are trying to connect to the correct IP?

No success with --ip=public_ip. Here are the log and config files: ``` $ cat .ipython/profile_mpi/security/ipcontroller-engine.json { "control": 33430, "task": 40887, "hb_ping": 35926, "mux": 50593, "pack": "json", "hb_pong": 44629, "ssh": "", "key": "ace4fb3f-5297-42b6-9682-4052c268dd22", "registration": 44932, "interface": "tcp://*", "iopub": 44723, "signature_scheme": "hmac-sha256", "unpack": "json", "location": "192.168.122.1" } $ cat ipengine-18925.log 2015-05-23 10:15:53.500 [IPEngineApp] Initializing MPI: 2015-05-23 10:15:53.500 [IPEngineApp] from mpi4py import MPI as mpi mpi.size = mpi.COMM_WORLD.Get_size() mpi.rank = mpi.COMM_WORLD.Get_rank() 2015-05-23 10:15:53.501 [IPEngineApp] Loading url_file u'xxx/.ipython/profile_mpi/security/ipcontroller-engine.json' 2015-05-23 10:15:53.524 [IPEngineApp] Registering with controller at tcp://127.0.0.1:44932 2015-05-23 10:16:23.553 [IPEngineApp] CRITICAL | Registration timed out after 30.0 seconds $ cat ipengine-19274.log 2015-05-23 10:15:53.144 [IPEngineApp] Initializing MPI: 2015-05-23 10:15:53.145 [IPEngineApp] from mpi4py import MPI as mpi mpi.size = mpi.COMM_WORLD.Get_size() mpi.rank = mpi.COMM_WORLD.Get_rank() 2015-05-23 10:15:53.145 [IPEngineApp] Loading url_file u'xxx/.ipython/profile_mpi/security/ipcontroller-engine.json' 2015-05-23 10:15:53.155 [IPEngineApp] Registering with controller at tcp://127.0.0.1:44932 2015-05-23 10:15:53.220 [IPEngineApp] Starting to monitor the heartbeat signal from the hub every 3010 ms. 2015-05-23 10:15:53.994 [IPEngineApp] Completed registration with id 0 ```

Can you show the connection files and logs when you use `--ip=public_ip` as well?

Can you also share the output of `ip -f inet addr | grep inet` on the engine machines, both remote and local?

Sorry for the long delay, but I wasn't in the office last week. Here is the complete output for --ip=public_ip and ip -f inet addr. ``` > ip -f inet addr | grep inet # Node that runs ipcluster inet 127.0.0.1/8 scope host lo inet 10.16.1.142/16 scope global eth0 inet 10.12.1.142/16 brd 10.12.255.255 scope global ib0 inet 192.168.122.1/24 brd 192.168.122.255 scope global virbr0 # Remote node inet 127.0.0.1/8 scope host lo inet 10.16.1.141/16 scope global eth0 inet 10.12.1.141/16 brd 10.12.255.255 scope global ib0 inet 192.168.122.1/24 brd 192.168.122.255 scope global virbr0 > cat .ipython/profile_mpi/log/ipcontroller-1549.log 2015-06-03 19:27:54.964 [IPControllerApp] Hub listening on tcp://*:45756 for registration. 2015-06-03 19:27:54.966 [IPControllerApp] Hub using DB backend: 'NoDB' 2015-06-03 19:27:55.230 [IPControllerApp] hub::created hub 2015-06-03 19:27:55.230 [IPControllerApp] writing connection info to xxx.ipython/profile_mpi/security/ipcontroller-client.json 2015-06-03 19:27:55.232 [IPControllerApp] writing connection info to xxx.ipython/profile_mpi/security/ipcontroller-engine.json 2015-06-03 19:27:55.233 [IPControllerApp] task::using Python leastload Task scheduler 2015-06-03 19:27:55.233 [IPControllerApp] Heartmonitor started 2015-06-03 19:27:55.238 [IPControllerApp] Creating pid file: xxx.ipython/profile_mpi/pid/ipcontroller.pid 2015-06-03 19:27:55.255 [IPControllerApp] client::client '\x00\xe98@\xa8' requested u'connection_request' 2015-06-03 19:27:55.255 [IPControllerApp] client::client ['\x00\xe98@\xa8'] connected 2015-06-03 19:28:35.480 [IPControllerApp] client::client '0de21428-8a22-416b-8492-7e32db6ec40d' requested u'registration_request' 2015-06-03 19:28:40.236 [IPControllerApp] registration::finished registering engine 0:0de21428-8a22-416b-8492-7e32db6ec40d 2015-06-03 19:28:40.237 [IPControllerApp] engine::Engine Connected: 0 > cat .ipython/profile_mpi/log/ipengine-1587.log 2015-06-03 19:28:35.467 [IPEngineApp] Initializing MPI: 2015-06-03 19:28:35.468 [IPEngineApp] from mpi4py import MPI as mpi mpi.size = mpi.COMM_WORLD.Get_size() mpi.rank = mpi.COMM_WORLD.Get_rank() 2015-06-03 19:28:35.469 [IPEngineApp] Loading url_file u'xxx.ipython/profile_mpi/security/ipcontroller-engine.json' 2015-06-03 19:28:35.478 [IPEngineApp] Registering with controller at tcp://127.0.0.1:45756 2015-06-03 19:28:35.547 [IPEngineApp] Starting to monitor the heartbeat signal from the hub every 3010 ms. 2015-06-03 19:28:35.551 [IPEngineApp] Running file in user namespace: xxx.ipython/profile_default/startup/10-magic.ipy 2015-06-03 19:28:35.870 [IPEngineApp] Running file in user namespace: xxx.ipython/profile_default/startup/20-imports.py 2015-06-03 19:28:36.395 [IPEngineApp] Completed registration with id 0 > cat .ipython/profile_mpi/log/ipengine-1966.log 2015-06-03 19:28:35.639 [IPEngineApp] Initializing MPI: 2015-06-03 19:28:35.639 [IPEngineApp] from mpi4py import MPI as mpi mpi.size = mpi.COMM_WORLD.Get_size() mpi.rank = mpi.COMM_WORLD.Get_rank() 2015-06-03 19:28:35.641 [IPEngineApp] Loading url_file u'xxx.ipython/profile_mpi/security/ipcontroller-engine.json' 2015-06-03 19:28:35.651 [IPEngineApp] Registering with controller at tcp://127.0.0.1:45756 2015-06-03 19:29:05.682 [IPEngineApp] CRITICAL | Registration timed out after 30.0 seconds > cat .ipython/profile_mpi/security/ipcontroller-engine.json { "control": 46244, "task": 47408, "hb_ping": 51534, "mux": 57636, "pack": "json", "hb_pong": 52690, "ssh": "", "key": "77aeede5-0d4b-4e8e-8660-0b7f78d85d60", "registration": 45756, "interface": "tcp://*", "iopub": 45561, "signature_scheme": "hmac-sha256", "unpack": "json", "location": "192.168.122.1" } ``` It's a remotely operated cluster, so I can't tell you more on its connectivity graph, but to me it looks like the ipcluster/ipengines are using the vibr0 interface where they should be using the eth0 interface.

Exactly,  your controller is sending 192.168.121.1 as the IP that engines should use to connect to it. This won't work as both machines use this IP address on virbr0.
Try setting one of the 10.x.x.x addresses your controller uses explicitly via the location parameter and this should be fixed.
